page.title: 17Stride's Haulage - Ropley
page.content: In 1969 our business began as a piggery and agricultural contracting. The agricultural side was soon in so much demand that it completely took over.We then had to supply our own transport to move our materials about the country as far afield as Royston and Gloucester.We increased the number of lorries to 5 and a Unimog to cope with the demand.This meant general haulage was out and we concentrated on farming materials.We also store for the farmer in order to spread at his convenience.After running for nearly 7 years there were new-comers to the village who objected to the transport. After a public hearing by the Dept.of the Environment we were granted permission to carry on our business.We employ 3 of the family full-time and 5 part-time lorry drivers. We spray and spread for farmers both near and far.
